Method Detail

getPage

@HW1.CS316Todo
@HW1.CS416Todo
public PageType getPage(PageId id)
Cached page access. This should check if the page is already in the buffer pool, and issue a read request to the file manager to pull the page into the buffer pool as necessary. Pages should be evicted as needed if the cache is full.

Parameters:
id - the page id of the page being requested
Returns:
an in-memory page reflecting the contents of the on-disk page

discardPage

@HW1.CS316Todo
@HW1.CS416Todo
public void discardPage(PageId id)
Return a cached page to the free list without flushing it, regardless of whether the page is dirty.

Parameters:
id - the page to flush

flushPage

@HW1.CS316Todo
@HW1.CS416Todo
public void flushPage(PageId id)
Flush a cached page to disk if it is dirty, returning it to the free list.

flushPages

@HW1.CS316Todo
@HW1.CS416Todo
public void flushPages()
Flush all dirty pages currently in the buffer pool to disk.

getWriteablePage

@HW1.CS316Todo
@HW1.CS416Todo
public PageId getWriteablePage(TableId rel,
                                                           short requestedSpace)
Buffered data access for adding data to the given relation. This method should support requests for a page with at least requestedSpace bytes free. If no such page is already in the buffer pool, a request should be made on files backing the relation in the file manager. The file manager may need to extend its current files, and any page returned should be added to the buffer pool.

Parameters:
rel - the relation for which we are requesting a page with sufficient free space
requestedSpace - the amount of space requested
Returns:
the page id of a page satisfying the space requirements

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
